I think moving UP is better because (2,4) is closer. From (1,1), I can continue moving towards (2,4) in the next steps without any immediate obstacles. Also, there's no enemy snake blocking my path, so it's safe. 

I should avoid moving RIGHT because it doesn't lead me directly to any apple and might take me on a longer path without any assurance of getting an apple before the enemy snake does. Also, staying near the left side seems riskier because I have limited space if I have to backtrack.

So, the best move is to go UP to (1,1) and then figure out the next steps from there. I'll keep an eye on the enemy snake's position in case it starts moving towards me, but for now, I'm safe to go for the apple at (2,4).
